content: 2 Solomon summoned all Israel—the officers of thousands and of hundreds, and the judges, and all the chiefs of all Israel, the heads of the clans.

content: 7 That night, the LORD appeared to Solomon and said to him, “Ask, what shall I grant you?”
content_old: 7 That night, the LORD appeared to Solomon and said to him, “Ask, what shall I grant you?”

content: 8 Solomon said to God, “You dealt most graciously with my father David, and now You have made me king in his stead.
content_old: 8 Solomon said to God, “You dealt most graciously with my father David, and now You have made me king in his stead.

content: 9 Now, O LORD God, let Your promise to my father David be fulfilled; for You have made me king over a people as numerous as the dust of the earth.
content_old: 9 Now, O LORD God, let Your promise to my father David be fulfilled; for You have made me king over a people as numerous as the dust of the earth.

content: 10 Grant me then the wisdom and the knowledge to lead this people, for who can govern Your great people?”
content_old: 10 Grant me then the wisdom and the knowledge to lead this people, for who can govern Your great people?”

content: 11 God said to Solomon, “Because you want this, and have not asked for wealth, property, and glory, nor have you asked for the life of your enemy, or long life for yourself, but you have asked for the wisdom and the knowledge to be able to govern My people over whom I have made you king,
content_old: 11 God said to Solomon, “Because you want this, and have not asked for wealth, property, and glory, nor have you asked for the life of your enemy, or long life for yourself, but you have asked for the wisdom and the knowledge to be able to govern My people over whom I have made you king,

content: 12 wisdom and knowledge are granted to you, and I grant you also wealth, property, and glory, the like of which no king before you has had, nor shall any after you have.”
content_old: 12 wisdom and knowledge are granted to you, and I grant you also wealth, property, and glory, the like of which no king before you has had, nor shall any after you have.”

content: 13 From the shrine at Gibeon, from the Tent of Meeting, Solomon went to Jerusalem and reigned over Israel.
content_old: 13 From the shrine at Gibeon, from the Tent of Meeting, Solomon went to Jerusalem and reigned over Israel.

content: 14 Solomon assembled chariots and horsemen; he had 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horses that he stationed in the chariot towns and with the king in Jerusalem.
content_old: 14 Solomon assembled chariots and horsemen; he had 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horses that he stationed in the chariot towns and with the king in Jerusalem.

content: 15 The king made silver and gold as plentiful in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars as plentiful as the sycamores in the Shephelah.

content: 16 Solomon’s horses were imported from Egypt and from Que; the ki king’s traders would buy them from Que at the market price.

content: 17 A chariot imported from Egypt cost 600 shekels of silver, and a horse 150. These in turn were exported by them to all the kings of the Hittites and the kings of the Arameans.

content: 1 Solomon mustered 70,000 basket carriers and 80,000 quarriers in the hills, with 3,600 men supervising them.
content_old: 1 Solomon mustered 70,000 basket carriers and 80,000 quarriers in the hills, with 3,600 men supervising them.

content: 2 Solomon sent this message to King Huram of Tyre, “In view of what you did for my father David in sending him cedars to build a palace for his residence—
content_old: 2 Solomon sent this message to King Huram of Tyre, “In view of what you did for my father David in sending him cedars to build a palace for his residence—

content: 3 see, I intend to build a House for the name of the LORD my God; I will dedicate it to Him for making incense offering of sweet spices in His honor, for the regular rows of bread, and for the morning and evening burnt offerings on sabbaths, new moons, and festivals, as is Israel’s eternal duty.

content: 4 The House that I intend to build will be great, inasmuch as our God is greater than all gods.
content_old: 4 The House that I intend to build will be great, inasmuch as our God is greater than all gods.

content: 5 Who indeed is capable of building a House for Him! Even the heavens to their uttermost reaches cannot contain Him, and who am I that I should build Him a House—except as a place for making burnt offerings to Him?
content_old: 5 Who indeed is capable of building a House for Him! Even the heavens to their uttermost reaches cannot contain Him, and who am I that I should build Him a House—except as a place for making burnt offerings to Him?

content: 6 Now send me a craftsman to work in gold, silver, bronze, and iron, and in purple, crimson, and blue yarn, and who knows how to engrave, alongside the craftsmen I have here in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom my father David provided.
content_old: 6 Now send me a craftsman to work in gold, silver, bronze, and iron, and in purple, crimson, and blue yarn, and who knows how to engrave, alongside the craftsmen I have here in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom my father David provided.

content: 7 Send me cedars, cypress, and algum wood from the Lebanon, for I know that your servants are skilled at cutting the trees of Lebanon. My servants will work with yours
content_old: 7 Send me cedars, cypress, and algum wood from the Lebanon, for I know that your servants are skilled at cutting the trees of Lebanon. My servants will work with yours

content: 8 to provide me with a great stock of timber; for the House that I intend to build will be singularly great.
content_old: 8 to provide me with a great stock of timber; for the House that I intend to build will be singularly great.

content: 9 I have allocated for your servants, the wood-cutters who fell the trees, 20,000 kor of crushed wheat and 20,000 kor of barley, 20,000 bath of wine and 20,000 bath of oil.”
content_old: 9 I have allocated for your servants, the wood-cutters who fell the trees, 20,000 kor of crushed wheat and 20,000 kor of barley, 20,000 bath of wine and 20,000 bath of oil.”

content: 10 Huram, king of Tyre, sent Solomon this written message in reply, “Because the LORD loved His people, He made you king over them.”
content_old: 10 Huram, king of Tyre, sent Solomon this written message in reply, “Because the LORD loved His people, He made you king over them.”

content: 11 Huram continued, “Blessed is the LORD, God of Israel, who made the heavens and the earth, who gave King David a wise son, endowed with intelligence and understanding, to build a House for the LORD and a royal palace for himself.
content_old: 11 Huram continued, “Blessed is the LORD, God of Israel, who made the heavens and the earth, who gave King David a wise son, endowed with intelligence and understanding, to build a House for the LORD and a royal palace for himself.

content: 12 Now I am sending you a skillful and intelligent man, my master Huram,

content: 14 As to the wheat, barley, oil, and wine which my lord mentioned, let him send them to his servants.

content: 15 We undertake to cut down as many trees of Lebanon as you need, and deliver them to you as rafts by sea to Jaffa; you will transport them to Jerusalem.”

content: 16 Solomon took a census of all the aliens who were in the land of Israel, besides the census taken by his father David, and they were found to be 153,600.

content: 1 Then Solomon began to build the House of the LORD in Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where the LORD had appeared to his father David, at the place which David had designated, at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
content_old: 1 Then Solomon began to build the House of the LORD in Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where the LORD had appeared to his father David, at the place which David had designated, at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

content: 2 He began to build on the second day of the second month of the fourth year of his reign.
content_old: 2 He began to build on the second day of the second month of the fourth year of his reign.

content: 3 These were the dimensions Solomon established for building the House of God: its length in cubits, by the former measure, was 60, and its breadth was 20.
content_old: 3 These were the dimensions Solomon established for building the House of God: its length in cubits, by the former measure, was 60, and its breadth was 20.

content: 4 The length of the porch in front to the breadth of the House—20 cubits, and its height was 120. Inside he overlaid it with pure gold.
content_old: 4 The length of the porch in front to the breadth of the House—20 cubits, and its height was 120. Inside he overlaid it with pure gold.

content: 5 The House itself he paneled with cypress wood. He overlaid it with fine gold and embossed on it palms and chains.
content_old: 5 The House itself he paneled with cypress wood. He overlaid it with fine gold and embossed on it palms and chains.

content: 6 He studded the House with precious stones for decoration; the gold was from Parvaim.
content_old: 6 He studded the House with precious stones for decoration; the gold was from Parvaim.

content: 7 He overlaid the House with gold—the beams, the thresholds, its walls and doors; he carved cherubim on the walls.
content_old: 7 He overlaid the House with gold—the beams, the thresholds, its walls and doors; he carved cherubim on the walls.

content: 8 He made the Holy of Holies: its length was the breadth of the house—20 cubits, and its breadth was 20 cubits. He overlaid it with 600 talents of fine gold.
content_old: 8 He made the Holy of Holies: its length was the breadth of the house—20 cubits, and its breadth was 20 cubits. He overlaid it with 600 talents of fine gold.

content: 9 The weight of the nails was 50 shekels of gold; the upper chambers he overlaid with gold.
content_old: 9 The weight of the nails was 50 shekels of gold; the upper chambers he overlaid with gold.

content: 10 He made two sculptured cherubim in the Holy of Holies, and they were overlaid with gold.
content_old: 10 He made two sculptured cherubim in the Holy of Holies, and they were overlaid with gold.

content: 11 The outspread wings of the cherubim were 20 cubits across: one wing 5 cubits long touching one wall of the House, and the other wing 5 cubits long touching the wing of the other cherub;
content_old: 11 The outspread wings of the cherubim were 20 cubits across: one wing 5 cubits long touching one wall of the House, and the other wing 5 cubits long touching the wing of the other cherub;

content: 12 one wing of the other cherub 5 cubits long extending to the other wall of the House, and its other wing 5 cubits long touching the wing of the first cherub.

content: 13 The wingspread of these cherubim was thus 20 cubits across, and they were standing up facing the House.
content_old: 13 The wingspread of these cherubim was thus 20 cubits across, and they were standing up facing the House.

content: 14 He made the curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarn and fine linen, and he worked cherubim into it.
content_old: 14 He made the curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarn and fine linen, and he worked cherubim into it.

content: 15 At the front of the House he made two columns 35 cubits high; the capitals on top of them were 5 cubits high.
content_old: 15 At the front of the House he made two columns 35 cubits high; the capitals on top of them were 5 cubits high.

content: 16 He made chainwork in the inner Sanctuary and set it on the top of the columns; he made a hundred pomegranates and set them into the chainwork.
content_old: 16 He made chainwork in the inner Sanctuary and set it on the top of the columns; he made a hundred pomegranates and set them into the chainwork.

content: 1 He made an altar of bronze 20 cubits long, 20 cubits wide, and 10 cubits high.
content_old: 1 He made an altar of bronze 20 cubits long, 20 cubits wide, and 10 cubits high.

content: 2 He made the sea of cast metal 10 cubits across from brim to brim, perfectly round; it was 5 cubits high, and its circumference was 30 cubits.
content_old: 2 He made the sea of cast metal 10 cubits across from brim to brim, perfectly round; it was 5 cubits high, and its circumference was 30 cubits.

content: 3 Beneath were figures of oxen set all around it, of 10 cubits, encircling the sea; the oxen were in two rows, cast in one piece with it.
content_old: 3 Beneath were figures of oxen set all around it, of 10 cubits, encircling the sea; the oxen were in two rows, cast in one piece with it.

content: 4 It stood upon twelve oxen: three faced north, three faced west, three faced south, and three faced east, with the sea resting upon them; their haunches were all turned inward.
content_old: 4 It stood upon twelve oxen: three faced north, three faced west, three faced south, and three faced east, with the sea resting upon them; their haunches were all turned inward.

content: 5 It was a handbreadth thick, and its brim was made like that of a cup, like the petals of a lily. It held 3,000 bath.

content_old: 8 He made ten tables and placed them in the Great Hall, five on the right and five on the left. He made one hundred gold basins.

content_old: 9 He built the court of the priests and the great court, and doors for the great court; he overlaid the doors with bronze.

content: 10 He set the sea on the right side, at the southeast corner.

content: 1 When all the work that King Solomon undertook for the House of the LORD was completed, Solomon brought the things that his father David had consecrated—the silver, the gold, and the utensils—and deposited them in the treasury of the House of God.

content: 2 Then Solomon convoked the elders of Israel—all the heads of the tribes and the ancestral chiefs of the Israelites—in Jerusalem, to bring up the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD from the City of David, that is, Zion.
content_old: 2 Then Solomon convoked the elders of Israel—all the heads of the tribes and the ancestral chiefs of the Israelites—in Jerusalem, to bring up the Ark of the Covenant of the LORD from the City of David, that is, Zion.

content: 3 All the men of Israel assembled before the king at the Feast, in the seventh month.
content_old: 3 All the men of Israel assembled before the king at the Feast, in the seventh month.

content: 4 When all the elders of Israel had come, the Levites carried the Ark.
content_old: 4 When all the elders of Israel had come, the Levites carried the Ark.

content: 5 They brought up the Ark and the Tent of Meeting and all the holy vessels that were in the Tent—the Levite priests brought them up.

content: 6 Meanwhile, King Solomon and the whole community of Israel, who had gathered to him before the Ark, were sacrificing sheep and oxen in such abundance that they could not be numbered or counted.
content_old: 6 Meanwhile, King Solomon and the whole community of Israel, who had gathered to him before the Ark, were sacrificing sheep and oxen in such abundance that they could not be numbered or counted.

content: 7 The priests brought the Ark of the LORD’s Covenant to its place in the inner Sanctuary of the House, in the Holy of Holies, beneath the wings of the cherubim;
content_old: 7 The priests brought the Ark of the LORD’s Covenant to its place in the inner Sanctuary of the House, in the Holy of Holies, beneath the wings of the cherubim;

content: 8 for the cherubim had their wings spread out over the place of the Ark so that the cherubim covered the Ark and its poles from above.

content: 3 Then, as the whole congregation of Israel stood, the king turned and blessed the whole congregation of Israel.

content: 4 He said,“Blessed is the LORD God of Israel, who made a promise to my father David and fulfilled it. For He said,

content: 5 ‘From the time I brought My people out of the land of Egypt, I never chose a city from among all the tribes of Israel to build a House where My name might abide; nor did I choose anyone to be the leader of my people Israel.
content_old: 5 ‘From the time I brought My people out of the land of Egypt, I never chose a city from among all the tribes of Israel to build a House where My name might abide; nor did I choose anyone to be the leader of my people Israel.

content: 6 But then I chose Jerusalem for My name to abide there, and I chose David to rule My people Israel.’
content_old: 6 But then I chose Jerusalem for My name to abide there, and I chose David to rule My people Israel.’
